result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shannon R Yager not in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Shannon R Yager.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in inpatient treatmet in Rock County. Offer and discovery received. Defendants appearance waived today. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:21 PM (64-06) Defendant Shannon R Yager appeared by video.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Shannon R Yager.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Renz acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead Not Guilty to all charges on behalf of her client.
Speedy reserved.
Motion to amend Bond - Argument by Attorney Renz.
Objection by Atty Herrmann.
Court will modify the the 10,000.00 SIGNATURE,  NO CASH - ALL SAME CONDITIONS, Also must participate in the In-Patient Treatment. 

Adj. 2:25PM
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

**AMENDED 08-12-2022:  NO CASH REQUIREMENT.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN.  DEFENDANT MUST PARTICIPATE IN IN-PATIENT TREATMENT.**

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Shannon R Yager in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for bond purposes only. Defendant is on PO hold. Bond set $10000 signature with $1000 cash component. Minutes filed.
